page.title: 07Dairy Farming.
page.content: There are several dairy farms in the area which produce milk which is collected and transported to Quinneys in Redditch. {Fowler's Dairy}has been established in the Midlands for many years and the present farmhouse was built in 1914.It is the only dairy producing cheese and butter within a radius of 88 miles. The present Mr. Fowler is of the fifth generation of the Fowler family.He owns a 100 cows and 1 Hereford bull. The cows are milked twice daily and produce an average of 1300 gallons per year for 1 cow. Most of the milk is used for cheese, the rest for butter. One gallon of milk makes one pound of cheese. Cheddar and Chesire cheese are produced and sold in many of the local shops in area.
